JobFullDesc: As an Opto-Mechanical Engineer at Facebook Reality labs, you will help design, develop, and integrate state-of-the-art precision instrumentation for metrology, lithography, and imaging.  You will be part of a team exploring new optical concepts producing research tools and prototypes integrating elements such as lasers, polarization optics, precision mechanisms, motion control, advanced sensors, and software. You may be part of multiple cross functional teams with specialists from many areas including electronics, mechanics, optics, firmware, and software. We want people who work well in teams, can brainstorm big ideas, are comfortable working in new and underdefined technology areas, and are able to drive a concept into a functioning hardware system. We are looking for a hands-on builder of opto-mechanical systems that can deal with sub-micron tolerances, create novel solutions, and clearly communicate across disciplines.Contribute to opto-mechanical engineering efforts in a cross-functional team environment.Brainstorm new system architectures and help the team converge on feasible Opto-Mechanical designs.Build, test, and refine opto-mechanical prototypes and custom high precision test fixtures.Create and refine system concepts that meet demanding schedule and performance targets.Help solve complex opto-mechanical system problems by inventing and integrating state-of-the-art technologies and methods.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBS or higher in Engineering, Physics, Optics or equivalent experience.3+ years of experience working in an engineering environment.Experience with mechanical, optical, and computational modeling software (Examples are SOLIDWORKS, Zemax, and MATLAB).Experience assembling and aligning custom benchtop optical and mechanical prototypes.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSBS or higher in Engineering, Physics, Optics or equivalent experience.3+ years of experience working in an engineering environment.Experience with mechanical, optical, and computational modeling software (Examples are SOLIDWORKS, Zemax, and MATLAB).Experience assembling and aligning custom benchtop optical and mechanical prototypes.Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
